name:ID: The Scheme is owned by the Construction Industry Council (CIC) and implemented by the Hong Kong Green Building Council (HKGBC).
:LABEL: Node

name:ID: The Scheme aims to help consumers, building professionals, and policy makers identify environmentally preferable building materials and products.
:LABEL: Node

name:ID: The Standard sets out the assessment criteria and their benchmarks for glazing products.
:LABEL: Node

name:ID: The Standard governs the application and award of a label under the Scheme.
:LABEL: Node

name:ID: The Standard defines the verification methods.
:LABEL: Node

name:ID: The Standard determines which labelling grade should be awarded to the product according to the assessment criteria.
:LABEL: Node

name:ID: This Standard neither modifies nor supersedes laws and regulations.
:LABEL: Node

name:ID: Compliance with this Standard is not a substitute for compliance with any applicable laws or regulations.
:LABEL: Node

name:ID: Glazing products are commonly used for fixed and opening windows, window doors, curtain walls, and other elements of the building envelope.
:LABEL: Node

name:ID: The glazing area of a building serves as an interface to transmit light and provide an outdoor view.
:LABEL: Node

name:ID: Many glazing products contain substances that may be harmful to the environment and human health.
:LABEL: Node

name:ID: The greatest environmental impact of glazing products results from energy losses during the building operation stage.
:LABEL: Node

name:ID: The assessment criteria developed for glazing are to promote the use of energy-efficient building envelopes.
:LABEL: Node

name:ID: The assessment criteria are to minimize the environmental impact through stringent assessment criteria on the production process and use of materials.
:LABEL: Node

name:ID: The scope of this Standard is applicable to glass in fixed and opening windows, window doors, and other elements of the building envelope.
:LABEL: Node

name:ID: Glass blocks and bricks or glass used for internal partitions are excluded from this Standard.
:LABEL: Node

name:ID: The Scheme is an environmental labelling scheme owned by the Construction Industry Council and implemented by the Hong Kong Green Building Council.
:LABEL: Node

name:ID: The Standard sets out the assessment criteria and their benchmarks for glazing products to govern the application and award of a label under the Scheme.
:LABEL: Node

name:ID: The Standard defines the verification methods to determine which labelling grade should be awarded to the product according to the assessment criteria.
:LABEL: Node

name:ID: Compliance with all applicable laws and regulations is a prerequisite for the manufacturing and marketing of the product.
:LABEL: Node

name:ID: Glazing products are commonly used building material for fixed and opening windows, window doors, curtain walls and other elements of the building envelope.
:LABEL: Node

name:ID: The glazing area of a building could account for 10 to 25% of a building's exposed surface, serving as an interface to transmit light and provide outdoor view.
:LABEL: Node

name:ID: Common types of glazing being used in architectural applications include clear and tinted float glass, tempered glass, and laminated glass as well as a variety of coated glasses.
:LABEL: Node

name:ID: The greatest environmental impact of glazing products results from the energy losses during the building operation stage due to their long technical service life.
:LABEL: Node

name:ID: The purposes of the assessment criteria developed for glazing are to promote the use of energy-efficient building envelope and to minimize the environmental impact through stringent assessment criteria on the production process and use of materials.
:LABEL: Node

name:ID: Each application should specify its types and product series.
:LABEL: Node

name:ID: One application is only for one product series with the same type of glazing.
:LABEL: Node

name:ID: Subsequent applications can be made for similar products with different thickness and/or coatings under a labelled product series.
:LABEL: Node

name:ID: A labelled product series is only eligible for applying within the validity period of the label.
:LABEL: Node

name:ID: Table 3 provides benchmarks for grading glazing.
:LABEL: Node

name:ID: A Platinum grade is awarded for 90 points or above.
:LABEL: Node

name:ID: A Gold grade is awarded for 80 to 89 points.
:LABEL: Node

name:ID: A Silver grade is awarded for 70 to 79 points.
:LABEL: Node

name:ID: A Bronze grade is awarded for 60 to 69 points.
:LABEL: Node

name:ID: A Green grade is awarded for 50 to 59 points.
:LABEL: Node

name:ID: No Label is given for below 50 points.

name:ID: HKGBC Green Product Accreditation and Standards [HK G-PASS]
:LABEL: Node

name:ID: It aims to help consumers, building professionals and policy makers identify environmentally preferable building materials and products.
:LABEL: Node

name:ID: It governs the application and award of a label under the Scheme.
:LABEL: Node

name:ID: The Standard defines the verification methods to determine which labelling grade should be awarded to the product.
:LABEL: Node

name:ID: The Standard neither modifies nor supersedes laws and regulations.
:LABEL: Node

name:ID: Compliance with this Standard is not a substitute for, and does not assure, compliance with any applicable laws or regulations.
:LABEL: Node

name:ID: The glazing area of a building could account for 10 to 25% of a building's exposed surface.
:LABEL: Node

name:ID: The greatest environmental impact of glazing products is resulted from the energy losses during the building operation stage.
:LABEL: Node

name:ID: The purposes of the assessment criteria developed for glazing are, therefore, to promote the use of energy-efficient building envelop, and to minimise the environmental impact.
:LABEL: Node

name:ID: Many of the glazing products contain substances that may be harmful to the environment and human health.
:LABEL: Node

name:ID: The scope of this Standard is applicable to glass in fixed and opening windows, window doors, and other elements of building envelop.
:LABEL: Node

name:ID: The Scheme is owned by the Construction Industry Council (CIC) and implemented by the Hong Kong Green Building Council (HKGBC)
:LABEL: Node

name:ID: The Standard sets out the assessment criteria and their benchmarks for glazing products
:LABEL: Node

name:ID: The Standard defines the verification methods to determine which labelling grade should be awarded to the product
:LABEL: Node

name:ID: Compliance with this Standard is not a substitute for, and does not assure, compliance with any applicable laws or regulations
:LABEL: Node

name:ID: Compliance with all applicable laws and regulations is a prerequisite for the manufacturing and marketing of the product

name:ID: Glazing products are commonly used for fixed and opening windows, window doors, curtain walls and other elements of the building envelop
:LABEL: Node

name:ID: The glazing area of a building could account for 10 to 25% of a building's exposed surface
:LABEL: Node

name:ID: The glazing area of a building serves as an interface to transmit light and provide outdoor view
:LABEL: Node

name:ID: Common types of glazing being used in architectural applications include clear and tinted float glass, tempered glass, and laminated glass as well as a variety of coated glasses, etc
:LABEL: Node

name:ID: Many of the glazing products contain substances that may be harmful to the environment and human health
:LABEL: Node

name:ID: The greatest environmental impact of glazing products is resulted from the energy losses during the building operation stage due to their long technical service life
:LABEL: Node

name:ID: The purposes of the assessment criteria developed for glazing are to promote the use of energy-efficient building envelop, and to minimise the environmental impact through stringent assessment criteria on the production process and use of materials
:LABEL: Node

name:ID: The scope of this Standard is applicable to glass in fixed and opening windows, window doors, and other elements of building envelop
:LABEL: Node

name:ID: Glass blocks and bricks or glass used for internal partitions are excluded from this Standard
:LABEL: Node

name:ID: Each application should specify its types and product series
:LABEL: Node

name:ID: Subsequent applications can be made for similar products with different thickness and/or coatings under a labelled product series
:LABEL: Node

name:ID: A product to be assessed should meet all the minimum requirements of the Core Criteria
:LABEL: Node

name:ID: be awarded a Green Label under the Scheme
:LABEL: Node

:LABEL: Node

:LABEL: Node

:LABEL: Node

name:ID: Targets shall be set to reduce the environmental impacts during the manufacturing process which include but not limited to the reduction of hazardous substance emissions, energy consumption, CO<sup>2</sup> emissions, secondary environmental load, waste management, water management, etc.
:LABEL: Node

:LABEL: Node

name:ID: The Applicant must demonstrate conformance to the assessment criteria.
:LABEL: Node

name:ID: Guarantee certificate supplied with the product or made available to the public, e.g. through manufacturer's website.

name:ID: Targets shall be set to reduce the environmental impacts during the manufacturing process which include but not limited to the reduction of hazardous substance emissions, energy consumption, CO2 emissions, secondary environmental load, waste management, water management, etc.
:LABEL: Node

name:ID: Instructions on how the product shall be installed, adjusted and protected in a sustainable manner, in order to prevent heat loss as a result of poor installation.
:LABEL: Node

name:ID: Information on the product's U-value, solar heat gain coefficient (SHGC) and visible light transmittance (VLT).
:LABEL: Node

name:ID: Instructions describing the recommended maintenance for the product.
:LABEL: Node

name:ID: Care instructions should contain details on how often the product should be checked and maintained, and what surface treatment is recommended.

:LABEL: Node

name:ID: The packaging materials shall: - o Not contain halogenated plastics,
:LABEL: Node

name:ID: The packaging materials shall: - o Be comprised of 100% recycled material or be readily recyclable, decomposable, or contain no coatings, impregnated chemicals or other materials that would prevent recycling or decomposition.
:LABEL: Node

name:ID: Verification Documentation describing the packaging materials used as well as their chemical composition (if any and where applicable), treatment process and recyclability should be submitted.
:LABEL: Node

name:ID: Durability and environmental performance of glazing products is advocated in the glazing industry due to the increasing awareness of "green products" among the contractors, architects and end-users, etc.
:LABEL: Node

name:ID: For example, high durability of glazing products can reduce resource consumption.
:LABEL: Node

name:ID: The technology adopted in the glazing manufacturing that can enable the glazing products to reduce resources used in: - o Maintenance, e.g. self-cleaning glass, etc.
:LABEL: Node

name:ID: The technology adopted in the glazing manufacturing that can enable the glazing products to reduce resources used in: - o Energy, such as lighting, e.g. instantly reactive glazing technology that changes the glass from clear to a dark blue tint, self-tinted glass, etc.
:LABEL: Node

name:ID: The overall heat transfer coefficient or U-value measures how well a glazing product transfer heat.
:LABEL: Node

name:ID: A low U-value indicates the glazing product is well insulated, resulting in a reduction of cooling load.
:LABEL: Node

name:ID: In this Standard, the U-value of the single, double or tripled glazing products shall meet the requirements.
:LABEL: Node

name:ID: Verification Documentation related to the above product information and instructions, web pages and any other information freely available to customers or the public.
:LABEL: Node

name:ID: The packaging materials shall: - Not contain halogenated plastics, and - Be comprised of 100% recycled material or be readily recyclable, decomposable, or contain no coatings, impregnated chemicals or other materials that would prevent recycling or decomposition.
:LABEL: Node

name:ID: The technology adopted in the glazing manufacturing that can enable the glazing products to reduce resources used in: - o Maintenance, e.g. self-cleaning glass, etc. Or - o Energy, such as lighting, e.g. instantly reactive glazing technology that changes the glass from clear to a dark blue tint, self-tinted glass, etc.
:LABEL: Node

name:ID: Verification Documentation describing the extra environmental features adopted as well as the product functions generated by the technology.
:LABEL: Node

name:ID: The product shall also not contain organotin compounds, phthalates or polybrominated diphenyl ethers (PBDEs), and classified as harmful – R20, 21 or 22, toxic – R23, 24 or 25, or very toxic – R26, 27, in accordance with EU Directives 2001/59/EC.
